intro: Eremophila micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved emu bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it drought-tolerant and suitable for dry landscapes. It plays an important role in attracting pollinators such as bees and birds due to its nectar-rich flowers.
